div.l: For whan þer eny ridynge was in chepe
Out of þe Shoppe þidere wold he lepe
Til þat he had al þe siȝt yseyn̄
And daunsed wel wold he not come a geyn̄
And gader͗e hym a mayne of his sort
To hoppe and synge and make such disport
And þer þei setten steuen forto mete
To pleyn at þe dis in such a strete
For in þe toune nas þer no prentys
Þat fairrer couþe cast a peire of dys
Þan ꝑperkyn couþe ⁊and þerto he was free
Of his dispence in place of pryvete
That fonde his maist̉er wel in his chaffar͗e
For oft tymes he fonde his boxe ful bar͗e
For sikerly a prentise Reveilour͗e
Þat haunteþ dis ryot and ꝑparamour͗e
His maister͗e shuld in his shop abye
Al haue he not part of þe mynstralcie
For þeft and riot þei ben conuertible
Al conne he pley on gitern or rubible
Reuel and trouþe as in lough degre
Þei ben ful wroþ alday as men may see
Þis Ioly Prentis wiþ his maist̉er bode
Til he were nygh out of his prentisehode
Al were he snybbed erly or late
And somtyme ladde wiþ revel to Newgate
But atte last his maist̉er hym by þouȝte
Vpon aday whan he his paper souȝte
Of a prouerd þat seiþ þis same word
Wel bette is roten appel out of horde
Þan þat it rote al þe remenᵃaunte
So fareþ it by a ryotous ʆseruᵃaunte
It is moche lasse harme to lat hȳm passe
Þan he sheed alle þe seruᵃauntes in þe place
Therfor his maister ȝaue hȳm a quytaıı̄unce
And bad hym goo wiþ sorowe and meschᵃuaunce
